intro: Aporosa lagenocarpa, commonly known as the bottle-shaped tree, is a member of the Rubiaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its unique, bottle-shaped trunk. The plant produces small, white flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and have a rough texture. The fruit is a globose capsule that splits open to release seeds when mature.
